intro: Scaphosepalum manningii, commonly known as the Manning's scaphosepalum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with good drainage. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a distinctive, elongated spur. Scaphosepalum manningii is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
